text: Hugo Alarik Jonsson (25 February 1884 – 9 April 1949) was a Finnish swimmer, who competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics. ==Aquatics== ===Olympics=== {|class="wikitable" style=" text-align:center;" |+ Hugo Jonsson at the Olympic Games |- !Games !Event !Stage !Rank !Time !Notes |- |style="white-space: nowrap;" rowspan=2|1908 Summer Olympics |style="white-space: nowrap;"|100 metre backstroke | First round |style="white-space: nowrap;"|3rd in heat |style="white-space: nowrap;"|unknown |align=left| Did not advance. Source: |- |style="white-space: nowrap;"|200 metre breaststroke | First round |style="white-space: nowrap;" colspan=2|Did not finish |align=left| Did not advance. Source: |} ===National=== He won some Finnish national championships in aquatics: * 4 × 50 metre freestyle relay: 1907 * Water polo: 1908, 1910, 1911 == Other == His father was a master stonecutter. He graduated as a construction engineer in 1903. He received the Cross of Liberty, 4th Class and the Commemorative Medal of the Liberation War. ==References== * Category:1884 births Category:1949 deaths Category:Finnish male swimmers Category:Olympic swimmers of Finland Category:Swimmers at the 1908 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Helsinki
title: Hugo Jonsson
